alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 9:09PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of , the southeastern City of Norfolk, the central City of Chesapeake and the central City of Virginia Beach through 945 PM EDT... At 908 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Great Bridge to 6 miles east of Virginia Beach. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibilty and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Virginia Beach, Regent University, Great Bridge, Kempsville, Deep Creek, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Fentress, Princess Anne, Cradock, South Norfolk, Rudee Heights, Portlock, Princess Anne Plaza, Sigma, Pungo, Greenbrier, Dam Neck and Mount Pleasant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
